source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Salvia
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria Vol. 4 Dicotyledons Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J. (1999). Salvia. In: Walsh, N.G, Entwisle, T.J., Flora of Victoria Vol. 4 Dicotyledons Cornaceae to Asteraceae, pp. 428-430. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves grey above; corolla white, sometimes pale lavendar; stamens exserted above adaxial lip of corolla
Leaves green above; corolla rusty-brown, blue, purple, lilac or pale blue; stamens remaining below adaxial lip of corolla
Perennial herb or annual subshrub to c. 70 cm high; abaxial lip of calyx with mucronate or spine-tipped lobes; corolla purple, bluish or white
Perennial shrub to c. 1.5 m high; abaxial lip of calyx broadly lobed; corolla rusty- brown
Branches with short simple retrorse hairs only; leaf-base cuneate to tapering, mar- gin crenate or almost entire
Branches with long multicellular, spreading to patent hairs, with or without short simple retrorse hairs; leaf-base truncate or cor-date, margin pinnatifid to pinnatisect or incised
Leaf margin crenate; inflorescence usually much-branched; corolla 3.5–5 mm long
Leaf margin almost entire, with shallow distant serrations; inflorescence unbranched; corolla 7–10 mm long
